Activities
The HAE3 is the Association of American Educational and Community
Radio and Television Stations,, Its services include workshops, seminars,
regional and national annual conferences, personnel upgrading programs,
consultant services, and numerous publications in radio and television,
including a monthly Newsletter. It maintains an active production pro¬
gram (Jeffersonian Horita^e. Ways of Mankind * People Under Communism.
Voices of Europe)«. and has an exchange-advisory membership relationship
with most national educational organizations• It also exchanges programs
and publications with the radio evsterns of some 23 foreign countries.
The MJEiB also maintains a Tape Network which duplicates and distri¬
butes to member stations several hours of programming per week. At present
there are 82 stations on the network. Since its establishment in 1951,
the Tape Network has distributed to its member stations 191 series of
programs totaling 50,049 hra and 27 min. of programing.
Subscription Rate for the Newsletter! <25.00 per year*
